the command of George H. W. Bush 's son George W. Bush George H. W. Bush . Another view on war's end The journal Foreign Policy also questions whether the war truly was successful. Memories of Desert Storm In ending the war unilaterally before Saddam had been chastened, the George H. W. Bush administration condemned the United States to a long-term presence in the Gulf in an effort to contain Iraq. This presence, and the sanctions imposed on Iraq due to Saddam's recalcitrance, in the end served as a rallying cry for jihadists such as Osama bin Laden against the United States and its friends in the region. Colin Powell , chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first George H. W. Bush and secretary of state under the second, was among officials gathered with the elder George H. W. Commitment and expertise are the most important factors he is looking for in a judge, Simon Cowell said, because they will have to work with the finalists five or six days a week throughout the competition. They also have to be competitive with each other, because the judges are competing, too. Each will be trying to guide his or her pupils to the grand prize.
